{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3488].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment and only  Issue Updated Notification is triggering. 

Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA (outbound email must be working, )
# Select any existing JIRA issue that you reported  (Assign ticket to different user)
# Click on Edit and add any comment on below edit screen
# Click update 

Actual Results:
The assignee will receive an email notification that issue has been updated. 


h3. Suggested Solution
The assignee should receive both {{Issue Updated}} and {{Issue Commented}} notification emails if comment is added using {{edit screen}}.

 
h3. Workaround 
- When adding a comment in a issue, just use the "comment" button in issue screen.
fields.summary: Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3475].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk not sending any email notification when issue is Closed

As stated in this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html
When a customer submits a request, they receive email notifications as the issue reporter when:
the request is created
a comment is added to the request
another participant is added to the request
the request is resolved with a set resolution field
the request is reopened with a cleared resolution field

So by default there will be no notification sent when the request is closed.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA SD will send email notification to reporter when issue is Closed
fields.summary: JSD not sending email notification to reporter when issue is Closed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3466].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When an Agent links a Confluence KB Page to a JIRA Service Desk Issue, they should have this link appear to the Customer in the Customer Portal. Currently, if an Agent uses this Feature, it is unknown to them that the Customer won't have access to see that resource, and can create confusion between the Agent and the Customer.

Furthermore, when an article is shared via the Confluence direct URL in a request, JSD will not count the request in "Requests resolved by agents sharing articles".

h3. Suggested Solution

There is currently a "Create KB article" button, but there should be a "Link to KB article" button (or some other mechanism) for already existing resources in the Knowledge Base.
 
h3. Workaround 

At the moment, the only way to link to already existing resources in the Knowledge Base is to either Wiki markup the link in a comment, or the paste the link in directly.
fields.summary: Confluence KB Page Links viewable in the Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See JSD-1597 where this problem was fixed for issue keys mentioned in comments.

The same problem still exists for issue keys mentioned in descriptions.

h5. Steps to reproduce
1. Login to one of the Customer Portals and create two requests.
2. Login as an Agent and view one of the issues from JIRA side.
3. Edit the description and mention the other issue key.
4. Log out and login back again as the Customer.
5. Click on the mentioned issue.

h5. Expected Result:
The customer is redirected to the portal view of the other issue.

h5. Actual Result:
Because the issue links to the JIRA view, the customer cannot access it and he is returned to the Service Desk portals page.

*Test ran on 4.12(latest)*: Note: This problem still exist for both comments and description.
fields.summary: When an issue key is mentioned in a description and comments it generates a link to the JIRA view instead of the portal view

h3. Problem Definition
Current Customer portal only can be set one language , by using translation plugin . There's no functionality to set multiple language , and the language depending on custom field value . For example , custom field called 'Locale' which contains Region information for ex: France, Italy, England etc, so language specific Customer portals for ex: Customer Portal in French language for France and English for US etc

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow language settings depending on custom field value or by Customer portal settings individually.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3463].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, the SLA Report is restricted only in one project, hence if the Agents want to see the SLA report for each project they need to navigate between the projects. 

h3. Suggested Solution:
It will be great if there is one page that could show all SLA report across the project. It will be like a massive Wallboard where the Agents could see every SLA report for every project. Since SLAs might be re-used between projects, and can be worked on by the same set of agents, having these reports available with shared SLAs over multiple projects would add a lot of value.
fields.summary: All SLA Report across projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3462].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Attaching and commenting on an issue to a customer takes multiple steps if using the 'respond to customer' button.  Clicking on 'more' and then 'attach files' brings up a single comment and attachment interface but the 'respond to customer' dialog does not allow you to both comment and add an attachment.  If you already have an attachment on the issue there is an attachment button now present on this screen to add the attachment into the comment.  
 !attachment.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution

This should be streamlined into a single interface so that you can add attachments directly when responding to customer rather than causing the user to have to remember to go through a different workflow to add an attachment.
fields.summary: Simplify Attachment/Comment process into single interface

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, if an Internal User or Agent are added as a "Request Participant" on a ticket, they will not retrieve any Internal Comment of that Request.

h3. Suggested Solution:
As that behaviour is by design, it will be great if there is a feature that will prevent any Internal Users to be added as the "Request Participant" or a warning that mention that the user would not retrieve any internal comment notification.

h3. Workaround:
Remove any Internal Users from the "Request Participant" field.
fields.summary: Prevention or Warning message when Agent tries to add Internal Users as Request Participants

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3456].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently request types do not allow for preset summary fields on request types. See [Receiving request by e-mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html] and [Hidden fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-HiddenFieldsHiddenfieldsandunsupportedfields] for reference. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
In some cases such as login password and common category request customer specified summaries aren't required. It would be useful for the summary to be able to be preset and hidden from the customer avoiding human error and a more efficient method from the customer end.
fields.summary: Preset values for Summary field.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3455].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

While the documentation for [Hidden and unsupported fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-HiddenFieldsHiddenfieldsandunsupportedfields] provide the customer with details about functionality on the feature however there aren't any clear instructions on how to configure it. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide detailed steps and perhaps a screenshot on how to configure it similar to the workaround mentioned below. As well as provide a reminder that Summary and Description are required visible fields [Recieving Request by e-mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html].

h3. Workaround 

# Please make sure your field/custom field is associated with your JIRA Service Desk project screen scheme. See [Configuring Fields and Screens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-fields-and-screens-187859099.html] for reference.  Please follow the [create a custom field custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/adding-a-custom-field-185729521.html] instructions if you need to create a to new field.
# Following the steps for [Customizing fields on request types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-CustomizingFieldsCustomizingthefieldsonarequesttype] specify the field as hidden and provide the value on creation or after the fact. 

See screenshot for reference. 

!step2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide configuration detail field preset values on request types.

fields.description:
h3. Actual behaviour
When a customer user JIRA Service Desk from a mobile device or a Mac he will tend to use an emoji like :poop: when something goes wrong or :thumbsup: when his issue is fixed really fast.

When he do this, he can't raise his issue or add comment. See attachted file.

h3. Expected behaviour
There are different ways to fix:
* Make the error message more user friendly so the customer knows what is the problem.
* Ignore / cut off the emoji from the input field and let the issue create without the emoji
* Make emoji availible ([https://github.com/arvida/emoji-cheat-sheet.com])  

h3. Notes
I read this KB [https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/0w6gGQ] with PostgreSQL as Workaround. Because i use MySQL i can't try if JSD will work with that or not.
fields.summary: Customer can't raise an issue when he adds an emoji in his text

The "Create with shared configuration" currently take over the following configurations when creating a new project:
* Permission Scheme
* Notification Scheme
* Issue Security Scheme
* Workflow Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When alterations to a permission scheme of a Service Desk projects have been made, the project administration page can display an error message as described on the following page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-660967497.html

In order to make adjustments to permission schemes, a user is required to be a JIRA administrator. Project Administrators do not have the permission to make alterations to an existing permission scheme, or assign another permission scheme to a project.

The error message as describe on the page linked above also shows up from Project Administrators, and they can choose to update the the scheme accordingly. This is *not* in line with the permissions they have on the environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user on a JIRA Service Desk instance and add it to the Service Desk license
# Create a Service Desk project and add the user from step 1 as Agent to it
# Grant the Agent the "Administer Projects" permission
# As a JIRA Administrator, remove the "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" for one or several permissions to trigger the error message
# Log in as the Agent, and navigate to the Project Administration page
# The error message will display, click the button to fix the error

h3. Expected Results
Since the Agent does not have the appropriate permissions to make alterations to permission schemes, or assign other permission schemes to a project, the option to fix the error should not be shown at all.

h3. Actual Results
The Agent is able to fix the errors, which follows the exact steps as described under the "What does the Fix permissions button do" section of the page linked above
fields.summary: Project Administrators can adjust permission schemes without having the permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3427].
  {panel}

Project administrators in Service Desk projects are capable of inviting agents to the Service Desk team of that project. This however only works if the agent in question has already been provided with an Agent slot on the JIRA Service Desk license.
As a result, one of 3 different situations can occur:
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does not* have an Agent license, and the project administrator *does not* have JIRA Administrator permissions, the user *will not* show up in the user picker at all.
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does not* have an Agent license, and the project administrator *does* have JIRA Administrator permissions, the user *will* show up in the user picker and can get added. A subscript message will be shown that 1 additional license slot will be consumed.
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does* have an Agent license, the user *will* show up in the user picker, regardless of the fact that the project administrator has been provided with JIRA Administrator permissions.

Situation 1 can cause confusion whenever project admins have been made responsible for setting up the Service Desk team. In many situations, providing them full instance administration permissions is not an option since this provides them a lot more privileges than required and wanted.
Instead, in situation 1 all users should be possible in the user picker, regardless of their license positions. If a user can not get added due to not having the appropriate license, a message should indicate that a JIRA Administrator needs to get contacted to provide the appropriate license to these kind of users.
fields.summary: Provide a better description on agent invites performed by Project Administrators

fields.description:
h5. Experienced Behavior:

Trouble is experienced when an agent or customer shares a link with a user who has permission to view the issue in JIRA but is not an agent and is not listed as a customer or request participant on that issue.

* As a customer, I encounter trouble sharing the link when I am viewing an issue through the customer portal.
** Example link: BASEURL/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/DESK-1
* As an agent, I also encounter trouble when sharing the link when I am viewing an issue through the customer portal.
* As an agent, I encounter trouble share the link when I am viewing an issue from the queues screen. 
** Example link: BASEURL/projects/DESK/queues/1/DESK-1

In both cases the user receiving the link is unable to access the request using the link. This user is able to access the request using BASEURL/browse/DESK-1

Message seen when visiting portal URL
 !Screen Shot 2016-02-16 at 7.54.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Message seen when visiting queues URL
 !Screen Shot 2016-02-16 at 7.54.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected behavior: 

The ability to provide another user with the link that is shown in my browser's address bar and for that user to be able to access the request using that link, provided they have permission to access the request.

h5. Suggested Resolution
Automatically redirect the user so that they are able to view the request.
fields.summary: Agents and customers experience problems when sharing links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3425].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently an agent can create a JIRA Service Desk issue within JIRA without a request type specified.  You can specify the request type on the view issue screen but not the create issue screen. You can specify the issue type but it will not fill out the request type according to issue type>request match.  It will produce a "No Match" on the view issue screen after the issue is created even though the issue type is configured for the request type. This is because one issue type can map to several request types so this can't be done automatically. 

See [Configuring request types and workflows |https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html] and [How JIRA and JIRA Service Desk work together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk025/how-jira-and-jira-service-desk-work-together-754977568.html] for reference. 
!nomatch.png|thumbnail!

Since you cannot specify the request type from create issue view within JIRA. It leaves a possibility that a customer may not be updated if an agent creates an issue from within JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Since issues should be created via the customer issues should be created via the customer portal by design. Agents should be directed to a JIRA Service Desk Create issue screen where the request type can be specified via either the customer portal, a modified create issue screen, or request type appears on the create issue screen if project type = Service Desk is specified.
fields.summary: Add a drop down option "Service Desk Request" to the Create issue button in JIRA.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3421].
  {panel}

Currently, several permissions have been granted to the "Customer Portal Access" entity, despite the functionality to provide these permissions the customer user types not being in place yet.
These permissions have been granted as placeholders for potential future feature releases.

This means, that as soon as such a feature gets release, and the JIRA Admin of the JIRA environment upgrades Service Desk, the customers in that environment will automatically get that permission granted.
This can pose a security issue if the JIRA Admin does not *want* customers to have these permissions.

Please remove these placeholders to prevent the potential security issue from above to occur. Instead, we need to properly inform customers when new feature become available, and which steps they need to take in order to provide these features to their customer.
fields.summary: Remove Customer Portal Access entity from all permissions currently not implemented

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Even though the Key from the language pack have been updated with the latest accepted string from the website, it did not update the string.
It is not a problem for a language that is not bundled by default, but for a language bundled by default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Download JIRA Service Desk German Language pack ver 3.2.0-OD-03-001 from https://translations.atlassian.com/
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons_
# Upload the downloaded JAR file with "Upload Add-on" feature
# Change the Default Language to Deutsch
# Navigate to a Service Desk project
# Invite a Customer and wait for the notification

h3. Expected Result:
* The notification will be using the latest string from the package:
{code}
Hallo,

<user> hat Sie zum Portal <portal-name> eingeladen!
{code}

h3. Actual Result:
* The notification still using the bundled translation from JIRA Service Desk:
{code}
Hallo,

<user> hat dich zum Portal <portal-name> eingeladen!
{code}

h3. Workaround
Install the plugin
-  German [^JIRA Service Desk-3.2.0-OD-06-ms1-language-pack-de_DE-altered.jar] 
- Japanese  [^JIRA Service Desk-3.2.0-OD-17-001-D20160623T024052-language-pack-ja_JP_altered.jar] 

h3. Notes:
* All the string could be found by extracting the Language Pack and "jira-servicedesk-application" JAR files.
* The example above is using the language pack {{JIRA Service Desk-3.2.0-OD-03-001-language-pack-de_DE.jar}} sd-18n with key/string found as:
{code}sd.email.conversational.notification.agent.invite.customer.description={0} hat Sie zum Portal {1} eingeladen\!{code}
* Comparing to the {{jira-servicedesk-application}} sd-18n for DE:
{code}sd.email.conversational.notification.agent.invite.customer.description={0} hat dich zum Portal {1} eingeladen\!{code}
fields.summary: Language Pack bundled by default did not update the new string for JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3411].
  {panel}

h3. +Problem Definition+
Currently, when an email have emoticons in it, the issue creation will be rejected by JIRA Service Desk *if MySQL is used as the JIRA database*.

!Screen Shot 2016-02-15 at 3.57.25 PM.png|thumbnail!

In the log, the following error should be seen:
{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraissue (ID, pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x9F\xA4\x94\x0D\x0A...' for column 'DESCRIPTION' at row 1)
{code}

h3. +Cause+
This is because email emoticons use 4-byte characters, while MySQL doesn't support this:
* [Add support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36135?src=confmacro&_ga=1.254773761.864456436.1434006745]

h3. +Suggested Solution+
JIRA Service Desk should auto render the emoticons as text, so that issues will be successfully created.

(i) This will also work if 4-byte characters are supported in MySQL.

h3. +Workaround+
Switch to a different type of supported databases: Postgre, MS SQL, or Oracle.
fields.summary: As admin, would like issue creation from email accept email with emoticon

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an Agent has been added as both a request participant as well as a watcher to a support request, it will not receive any notifications when internal comments are being added to that comment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Add 2 Agents to the Service Desk, Agent A and Agent B
# Add a customer account to the Service Desk
# Create a support request as the Customer
# Add both Agent A and Agent B as watchers to the request
# Add Agent B as request participant
# Add an internal comment as Agent A

h3. Expected Results
Agent B receives a notification of the internal comment being added.

h3. Actual Results
Agent B does not receive any notifications.

h3.Workaround
Refrain from adding Agents as request participant. Though there might be edge use cases that would require this to happen, it prevents notifications from being sent.
fields.summary: An agent will not receive notifications on internal comments when being both a watcher and a request participant

Hey Team

Our JIRA instance is:  https://visualjazz.jira.com/

I'm in charge of our (~50) Service Desks and am having some trouble with emails.

The ticket notification emails are coming through OK, and the replies are logging with the system fine.

The issue lies with the "Invitation" emails, when you invite a customer to join a Service Desk, and with the "Reset Password" emails, from the Service Desk Portal.

Many of our clients are reporting that these are just not being received.  I can think of at least 10 reports this year.

Is this a common issue?  Is there any way to resolve this without trying to have the domain whitelisted?

Thanks in advance for your help!
Donna

  {panel}

h5. Experienced Behavior

JIRA users are able to view Service Desk requests when granted "Browse Project" permission. These users are automatically able to view internal comments. 

h5. Expected Behavior: 

JIRA users are able to view Service Desk request when granted "Browse Project" permission but are not able to view internal comments unless they are a part of the Service Desk Team. 

h5. Suggested Resolution: 

Use project roles to determine if internal comments should be shown to users. A user who has "Browse Project" permission but no project roles should be able to view the request but not any internal comments. Users with "Browse Project" permission should be able to view internal comments when added to a project role such as "Service Desk Team" "Administrators" or "Developers"
fields.summary: Restrict internal comments to only users listed in project roles

  {panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 December 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

As a part of [Jira Service Management Data Center 4.21|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-21-x-release-notes-1096102630.html#JiraServiceManagement4.21.xreleasenotes-requests] we have released column configuration on the Help center’s request list view. This allows Jira admins to select the columns that they would like to appear in their customer's requests list. It also allows customers to configure and order the columns.

The available fields are type, reference, summary, status, service project, requester, created date, updated date, due date, assignee and priority.

Please refer to our documentation to [learn how to configure the requests list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-request-view-1095250690.html].

Kind regards,

Charlie Marriott
Jira Service Management, Data Center & Server
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
In Service Desk Customer Portal, the *Requests* page only shows a few columns by default.

h3. Suggested Solution
Examples would be  Created Date, Updated Date. These aren't fields that show in the same way as other fields, but the users would like some way to display this information in the Customer Portal
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to specify which columns show in Service Desk requests page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3385].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a Service Desk project for the first time, if a default issue type that would be created during the project creation process already exists, it must match the intended case sensitivity or project creation will fail.

For example:
If an issue type exists titled "INCIDENT", project creation will fail when creating an IT Service Desk as the process is attempting to create an issue type titled "Incident". This would also fail with any other case configuration that differs from the default "Incident", such as "INCident","InciDENT",etc..

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-01-001
* JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-12-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On an instance that currently doesn't contain a Service Desk project:
# Create an Issue Type titled "INCIDENT"
# Attempt to create an IT Service Desk
# Observe error:
 - {code}Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.{code}

h3. Expected Results
Projected should be created, using existing issue type's case structure.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:
{noformat}
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130911500 2016-02-02 11:23:40,122 http-nio-2990-exec-1301 ERROR sysadmin 683x221172x1 1ar6uib 4.15.43.214,165.254.226.114,127.0.0.1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130915500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: An issue type with the name 'Incident' exists already.
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130977500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:141)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130978500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:171)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130978500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:98)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130986500 	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor14289.invoke(Unknown Source)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130987500 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130988500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130996500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130996500 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy73.createIssueType(Unknown Source)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130997500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This has been verified on all issue types associated with the default Service Desk project templates. Project creation does not fail with the same scenario for JIRA Software and Business project templates.

h3.Workaround
- Edit the existing Issue Type to the default intended case sensitivity, and re-attempt project creation.
- If you would prefer a different case sensitivity of your issue types, you can create the service desk project and then edit the issue type afterwards.
fields.summary: Unable to create Service Desk Project if Issue Type exists with Different Case Sensitivity

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if an attachment is included in a notification, an inline preview of the attachment is visible within the e-mail notification. Attempting to access the attachment redirects to the instance's hosted location of the attachment, requiring the user to login to the instance to retrieve the full attachment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the option for attachments to be included as an actual e-mail attachment within the e-mail notification so that the attachment can be downloaded directly from the e-mail without having to login to the instance.

h3. Use Case
Many Service Desks operate strictly via e-mail with their user base. Requiring the user to login to the instance adds extra steps and therefore making the process inefficient to work with.

h3. Summary
Adding {{jira.permission.edit.group}} to a workflow status with a value of a group (eg. jira-administrators) will cause the SLA panel to be hidden for all users *not* in that group

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Service Desk project with Service Desk 2.x ( I tested with 2.5.9)
# Create a new issue which is in the status _Waiting for Support_
# Set up 2 users and verify that both of them are able able to view the SLA panel. One of them should not be in the _jira-administrators_ group
# Modify the workflow, adding the {{jira.permission.edit.group}} workflow property for the _Waiting for Support_ status with a value of a group (ie. jira-administrators)
# View the issue with both user again

h3. Expected Results
# Both users should still be able to view the SLA panel (top right) of the screen

h3. Actual Results
# User who is not a member of the _jira-administrators_ group will not be able to see the SLA panel

h3. Notes
This no longer happens in SD 3.x

h3.Workaround
Use the {{jira.issue.editable}} property instead
fields.summary: jira.permission.edit.group in a workflow status hides SLA panel from certain users
